A few days after the dislocation of his elbow, Tottenham had released a statement saying that his captain was not going to undergo surgery. After leaving the hospital, his wife reassured the supporters by posting a photo of him at home resting.




Bad news for Lloris




Hugo Lloris + 12 ðŸ“·Credit Photo - Icon Sport

However, after several clinical examinations, the doctors decided that Hugo Lloris should unfortunately have an elbow surgery which proves to be fragile. The goalkeeper had misjudged his support for Amex Stadium in Brighton and Hove Albion when he fell awkwardly on his left elbow. In a statement from the London club, they returned to the injury and the goalkeeper's operation: "The French goalkeeper dislocated his elbow and suffered ligament damage. Surgery was advised after the specialists found that the elbow remained unstable.

At 32, Hugo Lloris will have to make a big effort after his operation to return as quickly as possible to the highest level.
